I know this has been discussed before but I have not seen anyone on 
the group comment beyond the following:

"replace the junit assert() with assertTrue() and all will be well..."

Has anyone on the group started writing code with junit and the 
assert mechanism in jdk1.4?

When would you use an assert over a unit test?

If we had a math class with a sqrt method, and we wanted to assert 
that our method only handled non negative numbers, what is the 
difference between:

assert n > 0 (JDK 1.4)

and

JUnit test

try {
   Math.sqrt(-1);
} catch (IllegalArgumentException) {
   // ok - verified method throws proper exception
}


Jonathan
